articles.title: Why Sunderland v Newcastle means so much
articles.summary: Sunderland and Newcastle United will meet in the Premier League on Sunday for the first time in nearly a decade as "two worlds collide".

articles.title: Defining day of destiny awaits St Mirren & Celtic at Hampden
articles.summary: BBC Scotland previews the Scottish League Cup final between St Mirren and Celtic.

articles.title: 'The game that really matters' - pundits on Tyne-Wear derby
articles.summary: Football Focus pundits Stephen Warnock and Ashley Williams look ahead to Sunday's Tyne-Wear derby between Newcastle and Sunderland.

articles.title: Arsenal score dramatic late winner to avoid Wolves upset
articles.summary: Arsenal needed a second own goal after conceding in the 90th minute to defeat bottom of the table Wolves in a enthralling end to the match.

articles.title: Ekitike brace gives Liverpool important win as Salah returns
articles.summary: Hugo Ekitike is decisive in an important two goal win over Brighton, as Mohamed Salah marks his eagerly awaited Liverpool return with an assist.

articles.title: Match of the Day
articles.summary: Highlights from four Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Wolves.

articles.title: 'Worst 48 hours' since I joined Chelsea - Maresca
articles.summary: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says the past 48 hours are “the worst” since joining the club last summer.

articles.title: Liverpool icon Rush recovering in hospital from flu
articles.summary: Liverpool's all-time leading goalscorer Ian Rush is recovering in hospital after spending two days in intensive care with flu.

articles.title: Man arrested and match postponed as non-league manager injured
articles.summary: A man is arrested after Potters Bar Town manager Sammy Moore is left requiring medical treatment following an altercation that led to the postponement of their match at Welling United.

articles.title: Bristol Rovers sack Clarke after 10 straight losses
articles.summary: Bristol Rovers sack manager Darrell Clarke after a club-record run of 10 consecutive league defeats.

articles.title: 277 and out? Liverpool's Salah turns record breaker again
articles.summary: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah breaks former Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney's record for the most Premier League goal involvements with his goal against Nottingham Forest.

articles.title: Burnley can't give up goals in 'deadly' league - Parker
articles.summary: Burnley boss Scott Parker urges his side to cut out defensive errors in order to succeed in the Premier League.

articles.title: 'There is no issue to resolve' - Slot on Salah
articles.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot talks about Mohamed Salah after the Egypt forward returned for their 2-0 win against Brighton.

articles.title: Hurzeler says Brighton 'deserved more' from Liverpool defeat
articles.summary: A frustrated Fabian Hurzeler says that the goals conceded in his sides 2-0 loss away to Liverpool in the Premier League were "definitely avoidable." The Brighton manager wants improvements in the way ...

articles.title: Playing with Salah a 'blessing' - Ekitike
articles.summary: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike tells Final Score he looks up to players like Mohamed Salah, who returned off the bench today and assisted him for his second goal against Brighton

articles.title: Humphries relishing Worlds replay with Lim: That loss spurred me onto so much more
articles.summary: Luke Humphries says he is relishing the opportunity to face Paul Lim at the World Darts Championship once again five years on from his loss to the 71-year-old.
